summary: This document is the curriculum vitae of Bennett L. Gershman, a law professor at Pace Law School specializing in prosecutorial ethics, criminal procedure, and misconduct. It details his extensive academic career, publications, speaking engagements, and prior work as a prosecutor and defense attorney. The document appears to be part of a larger set of exhibits, possibly submitted in a legal proceeding.

keyFacts: Bennett L. Gershman is a prominent legal scholar and professor specializing in prosecutorial ethics and misconduct.
He has extensive practical experience, having worked as a prosecutor under Frank S. Hogan and later as a criminal defense attorney.
His CV lists numerous publications, blog posts, and op-eds commenting on high-profile criminal justice cases, including those of Dominique Strauss-Kahn, Casey Anthony, and George Zimmerman.
The document is part of a series labeled 'EFTA00073168' through 'EFTA00073185', suggesting it is an exhibit in a larger legal filing or investigation.
Gershman has served as an expert witness and consultant in legal cases, indicating he is sought for his opinion on prosecutorial conduct.
